rev.comment: Revert toi previous, vandal on names
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/65.73.101.48|65.73.101.48]] to last version by Smiemily
rv. please do not revert multiple useful edits to make a point.
Revert to revision 92102815 dated 2006-12-04 23:30:27 by Smiemily using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
Poor grammar in the opening paragraph was altered
reverting negative change -- it was massive exposure, and anyone can subtract 1995 from when she died.
/* Biography */ I have added some minor details
deleting vandalism; version of 18:59, 8 October 2006, was consulted; there is regular vandalism of this page
Reverting - yes, Polish born later a French resident and then citizen - as is detailed where it should be, in the main body of the article.
I think now is correct. I showed connections to both countries, and i wrote true: she was polish, she had french citizenship
Not actually French born, but not simply Polish. We need to stay on top of this absurd nationality war - any ideas?

I have changed the I in her sister Bronya's name; her name is usually spelled with a y.
